    /*
Ram is an astrologer who calculates the lucky number of people using their date of birth. He uses the
special formula to calculate their lucky number. The formula is dd*mm+yyyy if date of birth is in the
format dd-mm-yyyy.
Then he recursively adds all the digits of answer unless and until single digit is obtained. 
For example31-12-1995 is the date of birth of a person then his lucky number would be calculated as
 follow: 31*12+1995= 2367 => 2+3+6+7=18 => 1+8=9 So 9 is the lucky number.
Input

Input is a single line containing date of birth in the format "dd name_of_month yyyy" without quotes. Note: The name of the month starts with capital letter.
Output

For date of birth, output a single line containing the lucky number.
Example

Input:
31 December 1995

Output:
9
 */
import java.util.*;
class q
{
    public static void main(String args[])
    {
        Scanner sc=new Scanner(System.in);
        
        StringTokenizer st=new StringTokenizer(sc.next()+sc.nextLine()," ");
        int a=Integer.valueOf(st.nextToken());
        String d=st.nextToken();//System.out.println(d);
        int b=Integer.valueOf(st.nextToken());
        int val=0;
        switch(""+d.charAt(0)+d.charAt(d.length()-1))
        {
          case "Jy": if(d.charAt(1)=='a')       val=1;
                     else  val=7  ;              break;
          case "Fy": val=2; break;
          case "Mh": val=3; break;
          case "Al": val=4; break;
          case "My": val=5; break;
          case "Je": val=6; break;
          case "At": val=8; break;
          case "Sr": val=9; break;
          case "Or": val=10; break;
          case "Nr": val=11; break;
          case "Dr": val=12; break;          
        }
        //System.out.println(val);
        int v=(a*val)+b;
        while(v>=10)
        {  int s=0;
           String r=Integer.toString(v);
           for(int i=0;i<r.length();i++)
           s+=r.charAt(i);
           v=s-(48*r.length());
        }
        System.out.println(v);
    }
}
